Description: Part of a wooden panel painting: crouching child (Harpocrates).
Curator's comments: An international project for preparing a corpus of small panel paintings from Egypt was led by Prof Thomas Mathews, Univ. New York/Prof. Norman Miller, Univ. Princeton/Dr Vincent Rondot, Univ. Lille. As part of their research, the team visited the BM on 23-24 June 2005 and took a pigment sample from this panel.
Bibliographic references: Painting / Catalogue of the Greek, Etruscan & Roman Paintings & Mosaics in the British Museum: Paintings (88)
Rondot 2013 / Derniers visages des dieux d'Egypte: Iconographies, panthéons et cultes dans le Fayoum hellénisé des IIe-IIIe siècles de notre ère (pp.157-8, 251-2)
